name: Airbnb
description: Airbnb is a global travel community that offers end-to-end trips, including where you stay, what you do and the people you meet. Valued at over $30 Billion.

name: Stripe
description: Stripe builds economic infrastructure for the internet. Businesses of every size—from new startups to public companies—use their software to accept payments and manage their businesses online. Valued at over $20 Billion.

name: Cruise
description: Cruise is building autonomous vehicles to safely connect people to the places, things, and experiences they care about. Acquired by GM in 2016. Valued at over $14B.

name: Dropbox
description: Dropbox is a global collaboration platform where content is created, accessed, and shared. Market cap: over $10 Billion.

name: Coinbase
description: Coinbase is a digital currency wallet and platform where merchants and consumers can transact with new digital currencies like bitcoin, ethereum, and litecoin. Valued at over $8 Billion.

name: Instacart
description: Instacart is building the best way for people anywhere in the world to shop for groceries. Valued at over $7 Billion.

name: Machine Zone
description: MZ builds massive mobile games that break down linguistic and geographic barriers by uniting an unprecedented number of global players in one gaming world. They’re best known for the game "Game of War". Valued at over $5 Billion.

name: DoorDash
description: DoorDash connects customers with their favorite local and national businesses in more than 850 cities across the United States and Canada. They empower merchants to grow their businesses by offering on-demand delivery, data-driven insights, and better in-store efficiency, providing delightful experiences from door to door. Valued at over $4 Billion.

name: Zenefits
description: Zenefits provides HR solutions for the new world of work, powering people to make work move and business thrive. Valued at over $2 Billion

name: Gusto
description: Gusto automates and simplifies payroll, benefits, and HR, all while providing expert support. Valued at about $2 Billion.

name: Reddit
description: Reddit is home to thousands of communities, endless conversation, and authentic human connection. Acquired by Conde Nast in 2006. Valued at over $1 Billion.

name: PagerDuty
description: PagerDuty is the leading digital ops management platform for businesses. They empower DevOps, IT operations, support, security, and business leaders to turn any signal into insight and real-time action across any operational use case. Valued at over $1 Billion.

name: Docker
description: Docker is a modern platform for all applications, giving developers and IT the freedom to build, manage and secure business-critical applications without the fear of technology or infrastructure lock-in. Valued at over $1 Billion.

name: Ginkgo Bioworks
description: Ginkgo Bioworks is a biotech company that designs custom microbes for customers across multiple markets. Valued at over $1 Billion.

name: Rappi
description: Rappi is an on-demand delivery startup, active in Colombia, Mexico, Brazil, Chile, Uruguay and Argentina. Valued at over $1 Billion.

name: Brex
description: Brex is rebuilding B2B financial products, starting with a corporate card for tech companies. Valued at over $1 Billion.

name: GitLab
description: GitLab is the first single application built from the ground up for all stages of the DevOps lifecycle for Product, Development, QA, Security, and Operations teams to work concurrently on the same project. Valued at over $1 Billion.

name: Twitch
description: Twitch is a live streaming video platform where millions of people and thousands of interests collide in an explosion of video games, pop culture, and conversation. Acquired by Amazon in 2014.

name: Flexport
description: Flexport moves freight globally by air, ocean, rail, and truck for the world’s leading brands. Valued at over $1 Billion.

name: Mixpanel

name: Checkr

name: Optimizely

name: LendUp

name: Segment
description: Segment provides the customer data infrastructure that businesses use to put their customers first. With Segment, companies can collect, unify, and connect their first-party data to over 200 marketing, analytics, and data warehousing tools. Over 19,000 companies across 71 countries use Segment to achieve a common understanding of their users and make customer-centric decisions.

name: uBiome

name: Memebox

name: GoCardless
description: GoCardless is reinventing recurring payments by building a global network on top of bank debit systems. NOTE: we accidentally ommitted GoCardless from the orginal list. Correctly ranked, they would be #71.
